answerText: Fas cell surface death receptor [or FasR; or cluster of differentiation 95; or CD95; or tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 6; or TNFRSF6][10] The Fas receptor and the DISC help signal for this process of programmed cell death.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | Harvard A | 7 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Ligands bind to this receptor's "death domains." For 10 points each: [10] Name this TNF receptor that, when activated, releases active caspase-8. It forms part of the DISC.
